title: Sophie Monk WILL have a bigger role on Love Island Australia this year
text:
Sophie Monk has confirmed she will have a bigger role on the upcoming second season of Love Island Australia.

In 2018, fans expressed confusion on Twitter because the host barely had any screen time, but this won't happen again this year.

Sophie, 39, told OK! magazine the show's format has changed and she will be more involved than ever before.

'There's a little more of me': Sophie Monk (pictured) has confirmed she will have a bigger role on the upcoming second season of Love Island Australia

'[I will be on there] maybe a little more because there are a heap of new twists and turns on this season,' she said.

While her role is more wide-ranging than last year, Love Island will remain focused on the sexy contestants and their 'recoupling' ceremonies.

'The show is all about the boys and girls,' she said. 'I'm the host and I think people are more aware of how Love Island works [now] and what my role is.'

More prominent: In 2018, fans expressed confusion on Twitter because the host barely had any screen time, but this won't happen again this year

During season one, Sophie left viewers scratching their heads when she only appeared a handful of times.

Some fans even questioned whether Channel Nine executives had spent their money wisely after Sophie signed a rumoured $1million deal with the network.

'When is Sophie Monk coming back... the finale? Or did she just do the first episode and then f**k off,' one person tweeted last year.

Taking a back seat: While Sophie's role is more wide-ranging than last year, Love Island will remain focused on the sexy contestants and their 'recoupling' ceremonies

In May 2018, Channel Nine defended Sophie's limited screen time.

'The format of this multi-platform series revolves around our islanders,' a network spokesperson said.

'As host, Sophie's appearance in the villa means the islanders know something big is about to happen so [she] comes in whenever a major shake-up is made.'

Love Island Australia returns Monday, October 7 at 8.45pm on Channel Nine
